negative equity.translation[0].definitio: a situation in which someone owes more money on a mortgage (=arrangement to borrow money to pay for a house) than they would receive if they sold their house
negative equity.translation[1].definitio: when an asset, usually property, bought by a borrower with a loan is worth less than the loan remaining to be paid
the growing number of home owners with negative equity
when a companyâ€™s liabilities are more than its assets
The level of bad debts at some Thai banks may mean that some have negative equity.
